ParameterType.Name: RapidlyChanging
ParameterType.Description: Be prepared for a change every TimeStep in simulations, or every second in reality.

GNodeStrategy.Description:
Parameters:
GNodeInstance StartingActivePowerW ActivePowerW IsElectricallyConnected StartingIsElectricallyConnected
GNode.ComponentAttributeClass: RatedPowerWithdrawnVA MaxRampUpFractionPerS MaxRampDownFractionPerS
Strategy-specific parameters: DefaultRatedPowerWithdrawnVA DefaultMaxRampUpFractionPerS DefaultMaxRampDownFractionPerS StartingPowerSetpointFraction StandardRampFractionPerS IsElectricallyConnected
Listens to: - Admin.ConnectionRequest.TerminalAsset messages - Admin.SetpointRequest.TerminalAsset messages - NetworkModeler.ElectricallyDisconnect.TerminalAsset - WorldRoot.NewTimeSlice.TerminalAsset
Sends: - TerminalAsset.TimeSliceETQInput.NetworkModeler message - TerminalAsset.ConnectionStatusReport.Admin
Internally set variables: - IsElectricallyConnected as a function of TimeSlice index (immutable) - ActivePowerW as a function of TimeSlice index (immutable) - PowerSetpointW (mutable) - LargestReceivedTSIndex (mutable)
On Initialization, the terminal asset initializes all of its parameters above, setting ActivePowerW to StartingActivePowerW of 0 and IsElectricallyConnected to StartingIsElectricallyConnected of False, and PowerSetpointW to StartingPowerSetpointW of 0. It makes sure that the StandardRampRateFractionPerS is less than or equal to MaxRampUpFractionPerS and MaxRampDownFractionPers.
On receiving a timeslice with index tsIndex + 1 - it checks to see if this is the largest time slice received, and if so it moves on - updating LargestReceivedTSIndex - calculating its latest ActivePowerW using IsElectricallyConnected, its PowerSetpointW, its StandardRampRateFractionPerS - sends an ETQUpdate with IsElectricallyConnected and ActivePowerW
On receiving an Admin.ConnectionRequest.TerminalAsset: - It sets the state of IsElectricallyConnected[LargestReceivedTSIndex + 1] to match the request, and logs/reports information based on whether this matches IsElectricallyConnected[LargestReceivedTSIndex]
On receiving NetworkModeler.ElectricallyDisconnect.TerminalAsset: - It sets the state of IsElectricallyConnected[LargestReceivedTSIndex + 1] to false
On receiving Admin.SetpointRequest.TerminalAsset: - It changes its PowerSetpointW
GNodeStrategy.ShortDescription: <![CDATA[Has a setpoint which it ramps up & down to at a standard symmetric ramp rate.]]>

GNodeStrategy.Description:
Parameters used: CanIslandSafelyPowerBufferW, default 5000W
Listens to: - Admin.ConnectionRequest.ConductorTopologyNode messages (PleaseConnect or PleaseDisconnect) - WorldRoot.NewTimeSlice.GNode messages announcing a new time slice - NetworkModeler.TimeSliceEQEstimate.ConductorTopologyNode messages
It sends: - ConducturTopologyNode.TimeSliceEQInput.NetworkModeler messages w ActivePowerW (Decimal) and IsConnected (Boolean), per time slice - ConductorTopologyNode.ConnectionStatusReport.Admin. These include not only connection status but some description of why.
Internal variables: - IsConnected (Boolean). Default false - ActivePowerW (Decimal). Default 0.0 - CanIslandSafely (Boolean). Default true.
ON RECEIVING A ETQ Estimate Message from the Network Modeler: - If IsConnected is true, sets ActivePowerW to the ETQ estimate. - If abs(ActivePowerW) < CanIslandSafelyPowerBufferW, it sets CanIslandSafely to true. - otherwise it sets CanIslandSafely to false - If the value of CanIslandSafely has changed, it sends a note about this in a ConnectionStatusReport to admin.
ON RECEIVING A Disconnect Message From the Network Modeler: - Sets IsConnected to false - Sets ActivePowerW to 0.0 - Sets CanIslandSafely to true - Sends a ConnectionStatusReport noting that it disconnected at the request of the Network Modeler
ON RECEIVING A NEW TimeSlice MESSAGE FROM WorldRoot - If IsConnected is false: sends an ETQ Input message with "IsConnected false" and "ActivePowerW = 0.0" - If IsConnected is true: sends an ETQ Input message with "IsConnected true" and no information about ActivePowerW.
ON RECEIVING A ConnectionRequest from admin: - Evaluates the ConnectionRequest against its IsConnected variable. - If they match (i.e. PleaseConnect and IsConnected is true) it sends back a ConnectionStatusReport to admin saying its already in the requested state. Otherwise: - If the ConnectionRequest is PleaseConnect, sets IsConnected to true and sends back a ConnectionStatusReport to admin announcing. - if the ConnectionRequest is PleaseDisconnect, it checks if CanIslandSafely is true. If not, it sends back a ConnectionStatusReport with a note that it can't disconnect unless the abs(ActivePowerW) is less than CanIslandSafelyPowerBufferW. If it CanIslandSafely, then it sets IsConnected to false, ActivePowerW to 0 and sends a note about this in its ConnectionStatusReport.
GNodeStrategy.DisplayName: Simple DC Top Microgrid CTN Simulation (Rev 1)
GNodeStrategy.ShortDescription: Can connect and disconnect via admin command, gets updates from DC hack Network Model

GNodeStrategy.Description:
<![CDATA[Parameters:
ComponentAttributeClass: RatedPowerInjectedVA RatedMaxInverterEfficiency PVTotalAreaM2 decimal
RatedConversionEfficiency - this is a PV-specific number which has been going up over the last decade (main reason that PV is getting cheaper) that reflects the ability of the panels to convert Irradiance into electrical power. People typically assume that ConversionEfficiency drops by 1-2% a year. Dust also degrades ConversionEfficiency.
RatedPowerInjectedVA = StandardTestCondition_IrradianceWPerM2 * PVTotalAreaM2 * RatedSolarConversionEfficiency * RatedMaxInverterEfficiency, but we want to derive the MaxConversionEfficiency from the other number:
RatedSolarConversionEfficiency = RatedPowerInjectedVA / (PVTotalAreaM2 * RatedMaxInverterEfficiency * StandardTestCondition_IrradianceWPerM2)
Lexicon parameters: StandardTestCondition_IrradianceWPerM2 (1000?) integer. This is in fact a constant in the industry
Strategy-specific parameters: DefaultRatedPowerInjectedVA = 100000 DefaultPVTotalAreaM2 = 1000 DefaultMaxInverterEffiency = 0.71 InverterEfficiencyRamp_FractionOfMaxPerS = 0.05 Startup_InverterEfficiencySetpoint_FractionOfMax = 1;
IrradianceMeasurements. FILL IN
Listens to: - Admin.ConnectionRequest.TerminalAsset messages - Admin.SetpointRequest.TerminalAsset messages - NetworkModeler.ElectricallyDisconnect.TerminalAsset - WorldRoot.NewTimeSlice.TerminalAsset
Sends: - TerminalAsset.TimeSliceETQInput.NetworkModeler message - Communicates GNI.ActivePowerW, GNI.AdminPowerSetpointW
- TerminalAsset.ConnectionStatusReport.Admin - Communicates GNI.IsElectricallyConnected
Internally set variables: - LargestReceivedTSIndex (ONLY MUTABLE VARIABLE)
StartingIsElectricallyConnected = false StartingActivePowerW = 0
and all the strategy parameters & component attribute class paramters above.
SelfDirectedStateEnum: Startup, ATNRampingInverterEfficiency, PlantOperatorDirectlyRampingInverterEfficiency, Default
AvailableContractClassAliases - list of a single string ["sim.atncontrol.rev1"] which represents a contract between an atomic tnode and a simulated terminal asset. When the contract is in effect the commitment is to follow dispatch instructions from the ATN.
- IsElectricallyConnected[tsIndex] boolean (immutable) - ActivePowerW[tsIndex] decimal (immutable) - LiveContracts[tsIndex] list of strings (immutable) - IsSelfDirected[tsIndex] - boolean derived from LiveContracts. Should be true if and only if LiveContracts either does not have tsIndex as a key or if LiveContracts[tsIndex] is an empty list. - SelfDirectedState[tsIndex] = SelfDirectedStateEnum - ATN_InverterEfficiencySetpoint_FractionOfMax[tsIndex] InverterEfficiencyFractionOfMax[tsIndex] - will initialize to Startup PlantOperator_InverterEfficiencySetpoint_FractionOfMax[tsIndex] - will initialize to startup
Initialize_Strategy: On Initialization, the terminal asset initializes all of its parameters above, setting ActivePowerW to StartingActivePowerW of 0 and IsElectricallyConnected to StartingIsElectricallyConnected of False, and PowerSetpointW to StartingPowerSetpointW of 0.
NewTimeSliceReceived: - it checks to see if this is the largest time slice received. If not, it sends its old ETQ Update and stops
- if it IS the largest time slice received:
- It updates its only mutable variable LargestReceivedTSIndex
- It goes through the logic of updating all its dictionaries.
- calculating its latest ActivePowerW using IsElectricallyConnected, its PowerSetpointW, its StandardRampRateFractionPerS - sends an ETQUpdate with IsElectricallyConnected and ActivePowerW
On receiving an Admin.ConnectionRequest.TerminalAsset: - It sets the state of IsElectricallyConnected[LargestReceivedTSIndex + 1] to match the request, and logs/reports information based on whether this matches IsElectricallyConnected[LargestReceivedTSIndex]
On receiving NetworkModeler.ElectricallyDisconnect.TerminalAsset: - It sets the state of IsElectricallyConnected[LargestReceivedTSIndex + 1] to false
On receiving Admin.SetpointRequest.TerminalAsset: - It changes its PowerSetpointW]]>

GNodeStrategy.ShortDescription: World Coordinator for the first dotnet simulation. Did not have a working method of allocating supervisory capabilities to code running outside of its memory space.

GNodeStrategy.Description:
The network modeler assumes the network is DC instead of AC. The only electrical quantities that it pays attention to are IsConnected and ActivePowerW.
It listens to: - TerminalAsset.TimeSliceETQInput.NetworkModeler conversations. - ConductorTopologyNode.TimeSliceEQInput.NetworkModeler conversations. - WorldRoot.NewTimeSlice.GNode
It sends out: - NetworkModeler.TimeSliceETQEstimate.TerminalAsset conversations - NetworkModeler.TimeSliceEQEstimate.ConductorTopologyNode conversations - NetworkModeler.Disconnect.ElectricalComponent conversations - NetworkModeler.NewTimeSliceRequest.World messages - NetworkModeler.ChangeOperatingMode.TerminalAsset conversations (only to the diesel generator)
It has a strategy parameter TimeSliceTimerMs (or a better name) set with a default of 500 milliseconds. The timer starts when the NetworkModeler intercepts the announcement of a new TimeSlice. When the timer goes off, it runs its ETQEstimates and EQEstimates for that TimeSlice.
It has a list of TerminalAssets and the `sw1.ne.bf1.ff` GridRoot hardcoded as its slack bus.
It gets ActivePowerW readings from all the Terminal Assets (hardcoded to expect 2) and then adds them together and assigns the slack bus ActivePowerW to the negative of that.
If slack bus is null: Network modeler sends out Disconnect messages to all the terminal assets.
If slack bus is the fish farm: - All terminal asset ActivePowerW estimates are set to the ActivePowerW Input + small random noise - The ActivePowerW estimate for the fish farm is set to (-1)*Sum(ActivePowerW Input for terminal assets)
If slack bus is the diesel conductor topology node: - All terminal asset ActivePowerW estimates - EXCEPT FOR THE DIESEL TA - are set to their AtivePowerW inputs + small random noise - the ActivePowerW estimate for the fish farm is set to 0 - the ActivePowerW estimate for the diesel is set to (-1)*Sum(ActivePowerW estimate for terminal assets OTHER than diesel ta)
It ends the cycle by sending out ETQEstimates to all the terminal assets as well as an EQEstimate to the fish farm Conductor Topology Node, and then sending out a request for a new TimeSlice to world.

Parameters used: GNode.ComponentAttributeClass.RatedPowerInjectedVA GNode.ComponentAttributeClass.SolarFarmConversionFactorM2 GNode.ComponentAttributeClass.SolarFarmMaxIrradianceWPerM2 WorldInstance.SimulatedStartTimeUTC WorldInstance.TimeSliceDeltaMicroseconds
IrradianceMeasurementsAlpha_2014-7-17.csv (or another date)- file attached to this GRCNode using the file formatting of the IrradianceMeasurements table with columns TimeStampUnixMS, IrradianceHorizontalWPerM2, Location (Varenne)
Conversations: Listens to: - Admin.ConnectionRequest.TerminalAsset messages (PleaseConnect or PleaseDisconnect) - WorldRoot.NewTimeSlice.TerminalAsset messages announcing a new time slice - NetworkModeler.Disconnect.TerminalAsset messages
It sends: - TerminalAsset.TimeSliceETQInput.NetworkModeler messages w ActivePowerW (Decimal) and IsConnected (Boolean), per time slice - TerminalAsset.ConnectionStatusReport.Admin These include not only connection status but some description of why.
Internal variables: - ActivePowerW (Decimal). Default 0.0 - IsElectricallyConnected (Boolean) Default false - CurrentTimeSlice - default blank - WorldTimeUTC - default StartingTimeUTC - SolarMeasurementsStartTimeUTC - default WorldInstance.StartingTimeUTC - SolarMeasurementsEndTimeUTC - default WorldInstance.StartingTimeUTC - WithinSolarMeasurements - Boolean, default false - Initializing. Default true. - ElapsedTimeMS. Default 0 - IrradianceMeasurements - array of IrradianceMeasurements with the data structure matching the csv
UPON INITIALIZATION: Sets up its internal variables. Loads IrradianceMeasurementsAlpha_DATE.csv into IrradianceMeasurements (key-values w times as keys?). Make sure they are ordered chronologically, changing units for time from TimeStampUnixMS to TimeUTC (matching WorldInstance.StartingTimeUTC format) Set SolarMeasurementsStartTimeUTC and SolarMeasurementsEndTimeUTC using the first and last IrradianceMeasurements Checks that the WorldInstance.SimulatedStartTimeUTC is between SolarMeasurementsStartTimeUTC and SolarMeasurementsEndTimeUTC. If it is, set WithinSolarMeasurements to true. If not then send an error message about this.
WHEN IT GETS A ConnectionRequest FROM ADMIN: - Evaluates the ConnectionRequest against its IsConnected variable. If they match (i.e. PleaseConnect and IsConnected is true) it sends back a ConnectionStatusReport to admin saying its already in the requested state. Otherwise: - it updates its IsConnected to match the payload - sends back a ConnectionStatusReport to admin announcing this - if IsConnected got set to false, it sets ActivePowerW to 0
WHEN IT GETS A DISCONNECT MESSAGE FROM NETWORK MODELER It checks IsConnected. If IsConnected is True, it sets it to false, sets ActivePowerW to 0 and sends a ConnectionStatusReport to admin announcing that it disconnected because of a NetworkModeler disconnect message.
WHEN IT GETS A NEW TIMESLICE Update internal variable WorldTimeUTC: WorldTimeUTC = WorldInstance.SimulatedStartTimeUTC + (WorldInstance.TimeSliceDeltaMicroseconds/1000000.0)*CurrentTimeSliceIndex Check if CurrentTimeUTC is between SolarMeasurementsStartTimeUTC and SolarMeasurementsEndTimeUTC. - If it is not: set WithinSolarMeasurements to false and ActivePowerW to 0 - If it is: - set WithinSolarMeasurements to true. - Check IsConnected - If IsConnected is false then set ActivePowerW = 0 - Else: -Find the greatest IrradianceMeasurement.timeUTC which is less than CurrentTimeUTC (LatestIMTimeUTC) and set LatestIrradianceMeasurement = LatestIrradianceMeasurement[LatestIMTimeUTC]. - Set ActivePowerW = - LatestIrradianceMeasurement.IrradianceHorizontalWPerM2 * GNode.ComponentAttributeClass.SolarFarmConversionFactorM2
Sanity check: If this is greater than RatedInjectedPowerW, log a comment (it can in fact sometimes slightly exceed the RatedInjectedPowerW, which occurs exactly when the Irradiance actually exceeds SolarFarmMaxIrradianceWPerM2. Note that SolarFarmConversationFactorM2 is derived from RatedInjectedPowerVA and SolarFarmMaxIrradianceWperM2:
SolarFarmConversationFactorM2 = RatedPowerInjectedVA/SolarFarmMaxIrradianceWPerM2
Sends ActivePowerW and IsConnected (along with appropriate node TimeSlice info) to the Network Modeler in a TimeSlice ETQ Input message
GNodeStrategy.DisplayName: Simple DC Power Flow PV Simulation (Rev 1)
GNodeStrategy.ShortDescription: A first solar strategy designed for EJs First Demo, using asynchronous irradiance data. Deprecated as of Sept 16 2019.

GNodeStrategy.Description:
The network modeler assumes the network is DC instead of AC. The only electrical quantities that it pays attention to are IsConnected and ActivePowerW.
It listens to: - TerminalAsset.TimeSliceETQInput.NetworkModeler conversations. - ConductorTopologyNode.TimeSliceEQInput.NetworkModeler conversations. - WorldRoot.NewTimeSlice.GNode
It sends out: - NetworkModeler.TimeSliceETQEstimate.TerminalAsset conversations - NetworkModeler.TimeSliceEQEstimate.ConductorTopologyNode conversations - NetworkModeler.Disconnect.ElectricalComponent conversations - NetworkModeler.NewTimeSliceRequest.World messages - NetworkModeler.ChangeOperatingMode.TerminalAsset conversations (only to the diesel generator)
It has a strategy parameter TimeSliceTimerMs (or a better name) set with a default of 500 milliseconds. The timer starts when the NetworkModeler intercepts the announcement of a new TimeSlice. When the timer goes off, it runs its ETQEstimates and EQEstimates for that TimeSlice.
It has a list of TerminalAssets and also a list of ConductorTopologyNodes (diesel's node and fish farm).
WHEN IT RECEIVES A NEW TimeSlice: This kicks off starting a timer that runs for TimeSliceTimerMs. While that timer is running, it will also be receiving ETQInput and EQInputs from various terminal assets and from the fish farm conductor topology node. It checks to see that those terminal assets are in its list, and if they are it creates an Input.IsConnected Boolean variable and an Input.ActivePowerW decimal variable for that timeslice, node pair.
Once the timer is done:
The first thing it does is set the slack bus. It checks if the fish farm IsConnected ETQInput for this TimeSlice is true (and if the update is missing, it uses the value from the previous TimeSlice). If yes, then the fish farm is the slack bus. If no, then it checks if the diesel terminal asset IsConnected update is true. If yes, it sets the slack bus to the diesel generator. If no, then it sets the slack bus to null.
If the slack bus has changed, then it sends out a NetworkModeler.ChangeOperatingMode.TerminalAsset message to the diesel generator. if the slack bus is the fish farm or null, the message is "SynchronousMode true" if the slack bus is the diesel bus, the message is "SynchronousMode false"
If slack bus is null: Network modeler sends out Disconnect messages to all the terminal assets.
If slack bus is the fish farm: - All terminal asset ActivePowerW estimates are set to the ActivePowerW Input + small random noise - The ActivePowerW estimate for the fish farm is set to (-1)*Sum(ActivePowerW Input for terminal assets)
If slack bus is the diesel conductor topology node: - All terminal asset ActivePowerW estimates - EXCEPT FOR THE DIESEL TA - are set to their AtivePowerW inputs + small random noise - the ActivePowerW estimate for the fish farm is set to 0 - the ActivePowerW estimate for the diesel is set to (-1)*Sum(ActivePowerW estimate for terminal assets OTHER than diesel ta)
It ends the cycle by sending out ETQEstimates to all the teminal assets as well as an EQEstimate to the fish farm Conductor Topology Node, and then sending out a request for a new TimeSlice to world.

Admin can send a TA Setpoint message with message protocol alias sim.admin.solarfollowinghack.ta.rev1 to a terminal asset following this t
"MPAlias": "sim.admin.solarfollowinghack.ta.rev1", "GNodeAlias": "sw1.ne.bf1.ff.tank1.bigpump.ta"

GNodeStrategy.DisplayName: Simple DC Power Flow PV Simulation (Rev 2)
GNodeStrategy.ShortDescription: A first solar strategy designed for EJs First Demo, using asynchronous irradiance data. The irradiance value at a time slice is interpolated from the two closest values from the input data.

GNodeStrategy.Description:
<![CDATA[Parameters used: ComponentAttributeClass.MaxRampRateUpFractionPerSecond . (default 0.04) ComponentAttributeClass.MaxRampRateDownFractionPerSecond (default 0.08) WorldInstance.TimeSliceDeltaMicroseconds (default 500000) GNode.RatedPowerInjectedVA
Conversations:
Diesel.Radish.Rev1 key converstions. Listens to: - Admin.ConnectionRequest.TerminalAsset messages (PleaseConnect or PleaseDisconnect) - Admin.SetpointRequest.TerminalAsset messages (with SetpointW) - NetworkModeler.TimeSliceETQEstimate.TerminalAsset with ActivePowerW (Decimal) and IsConnected (Boolean) updates - NetworkModeler.ChangeOperatingMode.TerminalAsset - WorldRoot.NewTimeSlice.TerminalAsset messages announcing a new time slice
It sends: - TerminalAsset.TimeSliceETQInput.NetworkModeler messages w guesses for ActivePowerW (Decimal) and IsConnected (Boolean), per time slice - TerminalAsset.ConnectionStatusReport.Admin. These include not only connection status but some description of why.
Internal Variables: - LatestUnansweredConnectionRequest. This is either blank, "PleaseConnect" or "PleaseDisconnect". Default blank. - LatestConnectionStatusDescription. This is either blank, or a string of text. Default blank. - IsConnected (Boolean). Default false. - ActivePowerW (Decimal). Default 0.0 - LastTimeSliceActivePowerW. (Decimal). Default 0.0 - SynchronousMode (Boolean). Default true. - LatestTimeSlice. Default blank - LatestTimeDeltaMicroseconds. Default WorldInstance.TimeSliceDeltaMicroseconds - SetpointW. Default 0 - ActivePowerGuessW. Default 0. - IsConnectedGuess. Default false
UPON INITIALIZING it sets the internal state of its variables above to defaults.
WHEN IT GETS A ChangeOperatingMode conversation from the Network Modeler:
updates internal variable SynchronousMode to match the value in the message
WHEN IT GETS A ConnectionRequest FROM ADMIN (first validating that the request is for its node)
- updates its LatestUnansweredConnectionRequest to match the payload of the request (PleaseConnect or PleaseDisconnect). - updates LatestConnectionStatusDescription by appending "At time slice {LatestTimeSlice}, with IsConnected {IsConnected} received a request to {LatestUnansweredRequest}." - If the request is PleaseConnect AND if SynchronousMode is False it - updates LatestConnectionStatusDescription by appending "Generator is currently in Asynchronous mode. It will only connect in SynchronousMode. Request ignored" - sends a ConnectionStatusReport to admin with a payload of the LatestConnectionStatusDescription - updates both LatestUnansweredConnectionRequest and LatestConnectionStatusDescription to blank
WHEN IT GETS A Setpoint Request: updates SetpointW to match the request
WHEN IT GETS AN ETQ Update (first validating that this ETQ update is for its node): - Compares Update.ActivePowerW to its existing ActivePowerW to see if its ramp rate is exceeded: i.e. if Abs(Update.ActivePowerW - existing ActivePowerW) > (LatestTimeSliceMicroseconds/1000000.0) * RatedPowerInjectedW If ramp rate is exceeded: - sets LatestUnansweredConnectionRequest to `PleaseDisconnect` and appends LatestConnectionStatusDescription with `NetworkModel ActivePowerW update of {Update.ActivePowerW} is {Update.ActivePowerW - LastTimeSliceActivePowerW} Watts greater than ActivePowerW. Max allowed is (LatestTimeSliceMicroseconds/1000000.0) * RatedPowerInjectedW, or ({LatestTimeSliceMicroseconds}/1000000.0) * {RatedPowerInjectedW}). Sending Disconnect request to Network Modeler` - Sets its ActivePowerW internal state variable to the ActivePowerW it receives in the update - Sets its IsConnected internal state variable to the IsConnected Boolean value it receives in the update
WHEN IT GETS A NEW TIME SLICE ANNOUNCEMENT (ToAdd: send a message if the time delta between this TimeSlice and previous received is NOT WorldRoot.TimeSliceDeltaMicroseconds) - update LatestTimeDeltaMicroseconds
Determine IsConnectedGuess for New TimeSlice - If LatestUnansweredConnectionRequest is 'PleaseDisconnect' set LatestIsConnectedGuess = false, - Else if LatestUnansweredConnectionRequest is 'PleaseConnect' set IsConnectedGuess = true - Else set IsConnectedGuess to the value of internal state variable IsConnected
Determine ActivePowerGuessW - If IsConnected is false, set ActivePowerGuessW = 0 - else if SynchronousMode is false, set ActivePowerGuessW = ActivePowerW (i.e. the value from the ETQ update from the last TimeSlice) - else it moves towards the SetpointW from ActivePowerW by the amount allowed by its ramp rate in LatestTimeDeltaMicroseconds
- Sends ActivePowerGuessW and IsConnectedGuess (along with appropriate node & TimeSlice info) to the Network Modeler.
IN ISLANDED MODE:
it only sends IsElectricallyConnected (Boolean) and OperatingMode (Enum) in its ETQInput.
It attempts to balance the power on the grid. This means it attempts to set its ActivePowerW to the the ETQEstimate - with the caveat that a) it has to respect its upward and downward ramp limits]]>
GNodeStrategy.ShortDescription: First Diesel Strategy for the Sept 2019 NAF Demo. Uses the SimpleDC PhysicsParadigm (i.e. the physics model is that the only quantity to track is ActivePower, and it is not alternating.). ADD MORE.
First World Coordinator that has the ability to communicate with other Supervisors.

GNodeStrategy.Description:
Parameters used: GNode.RatedPowerInjectedW GNode.RatedPowerWithdrawnW
Conversations: Listens to: - Admin.ConnectionRequest.TerminalAsset messages (PleaseConnect or PleaseDisconnect) - WorldRoot.NewTimeSlice.GNode messages announcing a new time slice - NetworkModeler.Disconnect.TerminalAsset messages
It sends: - TerminalAsset.TimeSliceETQInput.NetworkModeler messages w ActivePowerW (Decimal) and IsConnected (Boolean), per time slice - TerminalAsset.ConnectionStatusReport.Admin. These include not only connection status but some description of why.
Internal variables: - IsConnected (Boolean). Default false. - ActivePowerW (Decimal). Default 0.0 - (Constant) ActiveConnectedPowerW. If `RatedPowerWithdrawnVA` is non-zero, then ActiveConnectedPowerW = 0.5*RatedPowerWithdrawnVA. Otherwise ActiveConnectedPowerW = -0.5*RatedPowerInjectedVA.
Initializes and sets its internal variables to their default values.
WHEN IT GETS A ConnectionRequest FROM ADMIN (first validating that the request is for its node) - Evaluates the ConnectionRequest against its IsConnected variable. If they match (i.e. PleaseConnect and IsConnected is true) it sends back a ConnectionStatusReport to admin saying its already in the requested state. Otherwise: - it updates its IsConnected to match the payload - sends back a ConnectionStatusReport to admin announcing this - if IsConnected got set to false, it sets ActivePowerW to 0 - if IsConnected got set to true, it sets ActivePowerW to ActiveConnectedPowerW
WHEN IT GETS A DISCONNECT MESSAGE FROM NETWORK MODELER It checks IsConnected. If IsConnected is True, it sets it to false, sets ActivePowerW to 0 and sends a ConnectionStatusReport to admin announcing that it disconnected because of a NetworkModeler disconnect message.
WHEN IT GETS A NEW TIMESLICE it sends an TimeSlice ETQ Input message to the Network Modeler with ActivePowerW and IsConnected
GNodeStrategy.ShortDescription: Runs at 50% of Rated Power (RatedPowerWithdrawnVA of its GNode,) when connected. Responsible for its own power. No ramping up or down. Does not listen to setpoint commands. The GNode.ComponentCategoryName must be Load.

GNodeStrategy.Description: A Network Modeler implementing the GWDynamicPhasor physics paradigm. This involves parsing the original octave code provided by Chris. ADD MORE.

GNodeStrategy.ShortDescription: MVP Supervisory strategy meant for a GNode with Role Supervisor - let's use the example `sw1.scalasuper.` This strategy receives a message with a list of GNode Instances (each GNode Instance - or GNI - specifies a GNode and a strategy) along with relevant initialization data. For each of the GNode Instances that HaveAgents and where `sw1.scalasuper` is listed as their Supervisor, it starts an agent implementing the strategy for the GNI on behalf of the GNode of the GNI. It also provides that strategy with its relevant initialization data.

GlobalAxioms.Name: FromGniIsLive
GlobalAxioms.Description: Check with the World Coordinator that the FromGNodeInstance.GNodeInstanceState is Live

GlobalAxioms.Name: FromGniMatchesGNodeAlias
GlobalAxioms.Description: Check with the World Coordinator that the FromGNodeInstance - as specified by its GNodeInstanceId - satisfies FromGNodeInstance.GrcGNode.GNode.Alias = FromGNodeAlias. If it does not, then update the GNodeInstance.GrcGNode.GNode's Alias

GlobalAxioms.Name: FromGniIdentifiesWorldInstanceGlobal
GlobalAxioms.Description: Check with World Coordinator Registry that FromGNodeInstance.SupervisorContainer.WorldInstance.Name equals Message.WorldInstanceName (where FromGNodeInstance is the GNodeInstance identified by FromGNodeInstanceId)

CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: DOCKER_IMAGE_NAME="${FIRST_DOCKER_NAME_COMPONENT}/${SECOND_DOCKER_NAME_COMPONENT}".

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: B is a GNode Child of A exactly if Parent(B) = A. In the code, Parent is expressed as a function while Child is a binary relation. There is not a bound on the number of children a parent can have. For the network modeling, we will be creating a vector space of CT Nodes underneath specific nodes (such as all the CTNodes at and below an Islandable microgrid). In order to run network model simulations we will want to have a canonical method of enumerating a basis for this vector space. While the GNode children are not inherently ordered between each other, it is convenient therefore that the GNode aliases provide a natural lexicogrphcial ordering on the children
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: GNode Child
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: B is a GNode Child of A exactly if Parent(B) = A. In the code, Parent is expressed as a function while Child is a binary relation. There is not a bound on the number of children a parent can have. For the network modeling, we will be creating a vector space of CT Nodes underneath specific nodes (such as all the CTNodes at and below an Islandable microgrid). In order to run network model simulations we will want to have a canonical method of enumerating a basis for this vector space. While the GNode children are not inherently ordered between each other, it is convenient therefore that the GNode aliases provide a natural lexicogrphcial ordering on the children

CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: Required for a Node to generate or receive any Events. If a GNode is active its parent is active as well.
CoreLexiconTerm.GNodeStatusDefn: Required for a Node to generate or receive any Events. If a GNode is active its parent is active as well.

CoreLexiconTerm.Name: RatedMaxInverterEfficiency
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: A rating associated with an inverter. Does not tend to change with time for a specific inverter. Belfast solar is 0.71

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: Derived column/ attribute in the GNode table, a function on GNodes, referencing either null or a GNode. The parent is determined via the natural gnode alias tree structure, and therefore is not immutable but can change as the alias changes. A GNode has no parents if and only if it has no separators in its alias if and only if it has the primary role of World Root.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: ParentGNode
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: Derived column/ attribute in the GNode table, a function on GNodes, referencing either null or a GNode. The parent is determined via the natural gnode alias tree structure, and therefore is not immutable but can change as the alias changes. A GNode has no parents if and only if it has no separators in its alias if and only if it has the primary role of World Root.

CoreLexiconTerm.Name: TimeCoordinator
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: An entity responsible for issuing TimeSteps. A WorldCoordinator is always a TimeCoordinator. However, there may be additional time coordinators (for example sending higher resolution TimeSteps to a sub-grid of the larger WorldInstance).
CoreLexiconTerm.GNodeRoleDefn: An entity responsible for issuing TimeSteps. A WorldCoordinator is always a TimeCoordinator. However, there may be additional time coordinators (for example sending higher resolution TimeSteps to a sub-grid of the larger WorldInstance).

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: This refers to the GNode that is the root of a tree. It is the only GNode that has no parent.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: WorldRoot
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: This refers to the GNode that is the root of a tree. It is the only GNode that has no parent.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: The GNode Aliases are strings whose tree structure as ordered sequences of words separated by a delimiter creates a fundamental underlying topology for the Gridworks Platform. Some of this topology is in fact the topology of the electric grid - in particular if you filter the GNodes by those whose PrimaryGnodeRole.HasVoltage you will end up with a graph where edges represent interconnection components (cables, wires, resistors) and where branch points represent vertices where multiple interconnect components come together. Since we are often working in scenarios where we discover more about the underlying topology with time, we allow the GNode Aliases to be updated in order to reflect our evolving comprehension of the electric grid. The default delimiter is a period, and the default read order is left to right. So for example `sw1.ne` is a child of `sw1`, and `sw1` (Simulated World One) is the root of a tree because it does not have a parent.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: GNodeAlias
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: The GNode Aliases are strings whose tree structure as ordered sequences of words separated by a delimiter creates a fundamental underlying topology for the Gridworks Platform. Some of this topology is in fact the topology of the electric grid - in particular if you filter the GNodes by those whose PrimaryGnodeRole.HasVoltage you will end up with a graph where edges represent interconnection components (cables, wires, resistors) and where branch points represent vertices where multiple interconnect components come together. Since we are often working in scenarios where we discover more about the underlying topology with time, we allow the GNode Aliases to be updated in order to reflect our evolving comprehension of the electric grid. The default delimiter is a period, and the default read order is left to right. So for example `sw1.ne` is a child of `sw1`, and `sw1` (Simulated World One) is the root of a tree because it does not have a parent.

CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: Can only be applied to TNodes that are in a simulated universe.

CoreLexiconTerm.Name: TerminalSsNode
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn:
A TerminalSSNodes is an infinitesimally long InterconnectionComponent that connects its parent (a ConductorTopologyNode) to its unique child (a Terminal Asset). The FromNode of a TerminalSSNode is its parent ConductorTopologyNode and its ToNode is its TerminalAsset.
NB: We may change 'child' to 'descendant' when we add metering and control devices as GNode parents of Terminal Assets.
A TerminalSSNodes has Electrical Quantities (current, voltage, etc.).
CoreLexiconTerm.GNodeRoleDefn:
A TerminalSSNodes is an infinitesimally long InterconnectionComponent that connects its parent (a ConductorTopologyNode) to its unique child (a Terminal Asset). The FromNode of a TerminalSSNode is its parent ConductorTopologyNode and its ToNode is its TerminalAsset.
NB: We may change 'child' to 'descendant' when we add metering and control devices as GNode parents of Terminal Assets.
A TerminalSSNodes has Electrical Quantities (current, voltage, etc.).

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: The unique minimal transitive irreflexive order on GNodes that is inherited by the Parent function. I.e. A < B iff A is a descendant of of B
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: GNodeLessThan(A,B)

CoreLexiconTerm.Name: NetworkModeler
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn:
A NetworkModeler is a GNode responsible for global coordination of either simulated or estimated reality in its associated grid. It must be the child of a GridRoot. Its associated grid is all the descendants of its parent which are part of the grid (e.g. InterconnectionComponents, Ctns ), or interact physically with the grid (e.g. AtomicTNodes, MeteringDevices).
In an entirely simulated world, we may choose to define the `real ElectricalQuantities` as the NetworkModeler estimates of the ElectricalQuantities associated to Ctns (Conductor Topology Nodes), InterconnectionComponents, TerminalAssets at each TimeStep.
CoreLexiconTerm.GNodeRoleDefn:
A NetworkModeler is a GNode responsible for global coordination of either simulated or estimated reality in its associated grid. It must be the child of a GridRoot. Its associated grid is all the descendants of its parent which are part of the grid (e.g. InterconnectionComponents, Ctns ), or interact physically with the grid (e.g. AtomicTNodes, MeteringDevices).
In an entirely simulated world, we may choose to define the `real ElectricalQuantities` as the NetworkModeler estimates of the ElectricalQuantities associated to Ctns (Conductor Topology Nodes), InterconnectionComponents, TerminalAssets at each TimeStep.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: GNR stands for GNode Registry - a service which maintains the authoritative list of GNodes and the attributes provided in the GNode Airtable. It is also responsible for maintaining the various axioms about what can change and not change - GNodeAlias CAN change, PrimaryRole cannot) and maintaining the consistency of the various axioms - for example, a GNodeAlias can only be associated with one GNode ever over time.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: GNR
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: GNR stands for GNode Registry - a service which maintains the authoritative list of GNodes and the attributes provided in the GNode Airtable. It is also responsible for maintaining the various axioms about what can change and not change - GNodeAlias CAN change, PrimaryRole cannot) and maintaining the consistency of the various axioms - for example, a GNodeAlias can only be associated with one GNode ever over time.

CoreLexiconTerm.Name: WorldCoordinator
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: <![CDATA[A World Coordinator is associated to a unique world instance, and has ultimate responsibility for the appropriate functioning of its World Instance. It maintains a user interface allowing Admin to make various changes - for example changing a terminal asset strategy so it runs in scala instead of python, or adding a GridRunClass that adds a whole new set of instantiated GNodes. This starts with spinning up a container for each of its Supervisors, providing these Supervisors with appropriate creation & change information regarding the World instantiated GNodes, their Components, and their Strategies. Critically the World Coordinator also allocates responsibility for GNodeInstances - its Supervisors create a disjoint cover of all GNodeInstances that HaveAgents. The WorldCoordinator can also be a Supervisor. The World Coordinator is created and initialized by the WorldInstanceRegistry (WIR). Note that the WIR also creates a world-specific message broker (i.e. the only messages running on this broker are between agents within this specific World Instance) for the WorldCoordinator.]]>
CoreLexiconTerm.GNodeRoleDefn: <![CDATA[A World Coordinator is associated to a unique world instance, and has ultimate responsibility for the appropriate functioning of its World Instance. It maintains a user interface allowing Admin to make various changes - for example changing a terminal asset strategy so it runs in scala instead of python, or adding a GridRunClass that adds a whole new set of instantiated GNodes. This starts with spinning up a container for each of its Supervisors, providing these Supervisors with appropriate creation & change information regarding the World instantiated GNodes, their Components, and their Strategies. Critically the World Coordinator also allocates responsibility for GNodeInstances - its Supervisors create a disjoint cover of all GNodeInstances that HaveAgents. The WorldCoordinator can also be a Supervisor. The World Coordinator is created and initialized by the WorldInstanceRegistry (WIR). Note that the WIR also creates a world-specific message broker (i.e. the only messages running on this broker are between agents within this specific World Instance) for the WorldCoordinator.]]>
CoreLexiconTerm.PhysicsParadigmDefn: A model of physics that starts with the PhasorRepresentation of ElectricalQuantities and uses differential equations, turned into difference equations, to model the change of the core state variable (which include but are not limited to ElectricalQuantities) from TimeStep to TimeStep. There are a number of different choices to be made within this context.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: A transfer function that describes how a terminal asset will take electrical quantity estimates and inputs from one time step and move them to the electrical terminal quantity inputs it calculates for the next time step. The TerminalAssetOperatingMode will be one of a finite enumeration of choices according to a TerminalAssetOperatingMode__Framework. Any framework is responsible for defining the meaning of the finite set of operating modes it enumerates.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: TerminalAssetOperatingMode

The TerminalAssetOperatingMode will be one of a finite enumeration of choices according to a TerminalAssetOperatingMode__Framework. Any framework is responsible for defining the meaning of the finite set of operating modes it enumerates.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: Active Power is the actual power consumed by a load. It is the product of voltage and current, multiplied by the cosine of the phase angle between voltage and current. It is measured in Watts.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: ActivePowerW
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: Active Power is the actual power consumed by a load. It is the product of voltage and current, multiplied by the cosine of the phase angle between voltage and current. It is measured in Watts.

CoreLexiconTerm.Name: GridConnected
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: The DieselOperatingMode where the Diesel follows SetpointW with its ActivePowerW, where SetpointW is provided by the PlantOperatorInterface. This is the OperatingMode that you would expect the diesel to be in when the microgrid is ElectricallyConnected to the larger grid.
CoreLexiconTerm.DieselOperatingModeSimpleDcDefn: The DieselOperatingMode where the Diesel follows SetpointW with its ActivePowerW, where SetpointW is provided by the PlantOperatorInterface. This is the OperatingMode that you would expect the diesel to be in when the microgrid is ElectricallyConnected to the larger grid.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: A unitless quantity between 0 and 1 which defines the limit of the ratio between reactive and active power. For example if a diesel generator has a PowerFactorLimit of 0.7 this means ActivePowerWithdrawnW/ApparentPowerWIthdrawnVA must be greater or equal to 0.7
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: ExcitationSystemPowerFactorLimit

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: The fraction of incident power (usually expressed in watts per square meter) that is converted to electrical power by a Photovoltaic cell.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: RatedSolarConversionEfficiency
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: The fraction of incident power (usually expressed in watts per square meter) that is converted to electrical power by a Photovoltaic cell.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: The name we give to physical data and derived physical data pertaining to electrical measurements. The foundational measured data depends on the PhysicsParadigm. For the SimpleDC PhysicsParadigm there is only one Eq, which is ActivePowerW. The distinction between an ElectricalQuantity and an ElectricalTerminalQuantity is that Terminal refers to a measurement at a TerminalAsset pertaining to the electricity flowing to or from the network and ground through that TerminalAsset.

CoreLexiconTerm.Name: TerminalAsset
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn:
A GNode representing physical device capable of injecting or withdrawing electrical power, at the location of its parent. The parent must be a TerminalSSNode. Equivalently, the primary role of the parent must be either AtomicTNode or TerminalSSNode
It may feel extraneous to have both a TerminalSSNode and a TerminalAsset. In most of the system, the TerminalSSNode will be representing the TerminalAsset - for example, we expect to say "oh this TerminalSSNode is a 3 kW storage heater." The asset allows for us to have different contexts of "same" and "different." In particular if the 3 kW storage heater has to be replaced, and it is replaced by a storage heater of the same make and model, then in this instance the TerminalAsset is replaced (including its immutable serial number, for example) but the TerminalSsNode keeps its name and id.
The TerminalAsset is also an InterconnectionComponent, where the FromNode is either its TerminalSsNode or AtomicTNode (note that when we introduce control devices this may expand) and the ToNode is Ground.
CoreLexiconTerm.GNodeRoleDefn:
A GNode representing physical device capable of injecting or withdrawing electrical power, at the location of its parent. The parent must be a TerminalSSNode. Equivalently, the primary role of the parent must be either AtomicTNode or TerminalSSNode
It may feel extraneous to have both a TerminalSSNode and a TerminalAsset. In most of the system, the TerminalSSNode will be representing the TerminalAsset - for example, we expect to say "oh this TerminalSSNode is a 3 kW storage heater." The asset allows for us to have different contexts of "same" and "different." In particular if the 3 kW storage heater has to be replaced, and it is replaced by a storage heater of the same make and model, then in this instance the TerminalAsset is replaced (including its immutable serial number, for example) but the TerminalSsNode keeps its name and id.
The TerminalAsset is also an InterconnectionComponent, where the FromNode is either its TerminalSsNode or AtomicTNode (note that when we introduce control devices this may expand) and the ToNode is Ground.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: The PhysicsParadigm refers to the underlying method that a GridRunClass is using to model the physics of the electric grid. It defines the set of message protocols that are used to send between agents in reference to Electrical Quantities on the grid. If there is a NetworkModeler for the GridRunClass, then the NetworkModeler maintains and uses the message protocols associated to that PhysicsParadigm.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: PhysicsParadigm

It defines the set of message protocols that are used to send between agents in reference to Electrical Quantities on the grid. If there is a NetworkModeler for the GridRunClass, then the NetworkModeler maintains and uses the message protocols associated to that PhysicsParadigm.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: Reactive power is the imaginary (or complex) power in a capacitive or inductive load. Reactive power represents an energy exchange between the power source and the reactive loads where no net power is gained or lost. The net average reactive power is zero. Reactive power is stored in and discharged by inductive motors, transformers, solenoids and capacitors.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: ReactivePower
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: Reactive power is the imaginary (or complex) power in a capacitive or inductive load. Reactive power represents an energy exchange between the power source and the reactive loads where no net power is gained or lost. The net average reactive power is zero. Reactive power is stored in and discharged by inductive motors, transformers, solenoids and capacitors.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: An adjective that applies to phasor and instantaneous current and power measurements associated to TopologyModelEdges. A positive flow number indicates that the power and current are flowing along the direction of the directed edge.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: Flow

The distinction between an ElectricalQuantity and an ElectricalTerminalQuantity is that Terminal refers to a measurement at a TerminalAsset pertaining to the electricity flowing to or from the network and ground through that TerminalAsset.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: Derived from the GNode's Component: GNode.ComponentAttributeClass = GNode.Component.ComponentAttributeClass. If you called Siemens and said "Here's the model of the wind turbine I bought. I'd like another one." You'd be getting a second Component belonging to the same ComponentAttributeClass. This is where a Component, and therefore a GNode ,will inherit its RatedPowerWithdrawnVA or RatedPowerInjectedVA for example.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: A service with authority within its World Instance for (GNodeAlias, GNIRID, GNodeStatus). The expectation is that message passing within a World Instance often includes the GNodeAlias in the header, and this is used for routing messages. Once the message is inspected, the payload will also include whole triple (GNodeAlias, GNIRID, GNodeStatus) as understood by the sender. If there is a conflict between sender and receiver then conflict resolution occurs through the GNIRegistry.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: GNIRegistry
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: A service with authority within its World Instance for (GNodeAlias, GNIRID, GNodeStatus). The expectation is that message passing within a World Instance often includes the GNodeAlias in the header, and this is used for routing messages. Once the message is inspected, the payload will also include whole triple (GNodeAlias, GNIRID, GNodeStatus) as understood by the sender. If there is a conflict between sender and receiver then conflict resolution occurs through the GNIRegistry.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: The immutable identifier for a GNode. However, under most circumstances the platform is expected to behave as if the GNodeAlias At present the type is XX (AirTableUniqueID). GNode.GNodeAlias may change slowly over time and eventual consistency is meant to be querying a GNode Registry with the GNodeAlias and an immutable ID.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: GNodeId
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: The immutable identifier for a GNode. However, under most circumstances the platform is expected to behave as if the GNodeAlias At present the type is XX (AirTableUniqueID). GNode.GNodeAlias may change slowly over time and eventual consistency is meant to be querying a GNode Registry with the GNodeAlias and an immutable ID.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition:
A GNode is a fundamental unit of abstraction in the Gridworks Platform. GNodes have a tree structure instantiated with the Parent function in the GNode table. This tree structure is used both as a method of capturing known topological information about electric grids, and as an organizational principle for coding actions and functions.
All GNodes have a unique identifier which is immutable, and a GNodeAlias which changes infrequently and captures key organizational structure information.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: GNode
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn:
A GNode is a fundamental unit of abstraction in the Gridworks Platform. GNodes have a tree structure instantiated with the Parent function in the GNode table. This tree structure is used both as a method of capturing known topological information about electric grids, and as an organizational principle for coding actions and functions.
All GNodes have a unique identifier which is immutable, and a GNodeAlias which changes infrequently and captures key organizational structure information.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: Some GNodes are associated to a primary Component, which can change with time. The major example of this is a Terminal Asset. For example, a specific Diesel Generator - i.e. the spare that somebody spray-painted with a flower - is a Component. If it gets attached at one place on the microgrid network it becomes the primary Component from one Terminal Asset. If it gets moved to a new location it becomes the primary Component for a DIFFERENT Terminal Asset. If the spare has enough of the same physical characteristics as the original, the operators of the microgrid can make the call that swapping the two does not change the TerminalAsset. However, if the RatedPowerInjectedVA doubles that would be a new TerminalAsset. In most contexts, we associate the characteristics of a Component which is the Primary Component of a GNode directly with the GNode itself.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: GNode__PrimaryComponent
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: Some GNodes are associated to a primary Component, which can change with time. The major example of this is a Terminal Asset. For example, a specific Diesel Generator - i.e. the spare that somebody spray-painted with a flower - is a Component. If it gets attached at one place on the microgrid network it becomes the primary Component from one Terminal Asset. If it gets moved to a new location it becomes the primary Component for a DIFFERENT Terminal Asset. If the spare has enough of the same physical characteristics as the original, the operators of the microgrid can make the call that swapping the two does not change the TerminalAsset. However, if the RatedPowerInjectedVA doubles that would be a new TerminalAsset. In most contexts, we associate the characteristics of a Component which is the Primary Component of a GNode directly with the GNode itself.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: This refers to the number of TimeSlices per simulated second for a particular GridRunClass. The number of TimeSlices per second in reality depends on the TimeContractionFactor for the GridRunClass. For example if the SampleRateHz is 2 and the TimeContractionFactor is 0.5 then there are two TimeSlices per simulated second and a real second is half as long as a simulated second, so there is one TimeSlice per actual second.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: SampleRateHz
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: This refers to the number of TimeSlices per simulated second for a particular GridRunClass. The number of TimeSlices per second in reality depends on the TimeContractionFactor for the GridRunClass. For example if the SampleRateHz is 2 and the TimeContractionFactor is 0.5 then there are two TimeSlices per simulated second and a real second is half as long as a simulated second, so there is one TimeSlice per actual second.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: The angle between the sinusoidal PhasorCurrent and PhasorVoltage in the phasor representation of AC power systems.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: PhaseAngle
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: The angle between the sinusoidal PhasorCurrent and PhasorVoltage in the phasor representation of AC power systems.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: A synonym for ActivePower
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: RealPower
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: A synonym for ActivePower

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: This is a term we use to help organize and explain our technology work streams. This term is widely used in the software industry. We like the definition below provided by Atlassian: DevOps is a set of practices that automates the processes between software development and IT teams, in order that they can build, test, and release software faster and more reliably. The concept of DevOps is founded on building a culture of collaboration between teams that historically functioned in relative siloes. The promised benefits include increased trust, faster software releases, ability to solve critical issues quickly, and better manage unplanned work.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: DevOps
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: This is a term we use to help organize and explain our technology work streams. This term is widely used in the software industry. We like the definition below provided by Atlassian: DevOps is a set of practices that automates the processes between software development and IT teams, in order that they can build, test, and release software faster and more reliably. The concept of DevOps is founded on building a culture of collaboration between teams that historically functioned in relative siloes. The promised benefits include increased trust, faster software releases, ability to solve critical issues quickly, and better manage unplanned work.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: A loosely defined industry term meaning an aggregation of electrical generators and loads. We use the term synonymously with Aggregated TNode. Note that the DOE definition of Microgrid is in fact our definition of IslandableMicrogrid below.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: Microgrid
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: A loosely defined industry term meaning an aggregation of electrical generators and loads. We use the term synonymously with Aggregated TNode. Note that the DOE definition of Microgrid is in fact our definition of IslandableMicrogrid below.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: A collection of unary relationships on GNodes used to determine the meaning and behavior of the GNodes. At present there is a many-many relationship between GNodeRoles and GNodes. We are moving towards increasing the number of roles and making this a many-to-one relationship.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: GNodeRole
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: A collection of unary relationships on GNodes used to determine the meaning and behavior of the GNodes. At present there is a many-many relationship between GNodeRoles and GNodes. We are moving towards increasing the number of roles and making this a many-to-one relationship.

CoreLexiconTerm.Name: SimpleDC
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: The PhysicsParadigm that assumes all power on the electric grid is Direct Current (DC), and that the only electrical quantity to measure is ActivePowerW. This paradigm does not reference voltage, current or phase angle. It is extremely limited in the context of modeling a microgrid but is often sufficient for running longer term (e.g. hour-long) electrical energy contracts.
CoreLexiconTerm.PhysicsParadigmDefn: The PhysicsParadigm that assumes all power on the electric grid is Direct Current (DC), and that the only electrical quantity to measure is ActivePowerW. This paradigm does not reference voltage, current or phase angle. It is extremely limited in the context of modeling a microgrid but is often sufficient for running longer term (e.g. hour-long) electrical energy contracts.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: The size in square meters of a PV array
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: PVTotalAreaM2
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: The size in square meters of a PV array

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: The product of voltage and current, without taking into account their relative phase angle. It is equal to the square root of the sum of the squares of Active Power and Reactive Power. Its units are VA.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: ApparentPower
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: The product of voltage and current, without taking into account their relative phase angle. It is equal to the square root of the sum of the squares of Active Power and Reactive Power. Its units are VA.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: For all GNodes, either Parent(GNode) is null (which means that GNode defines a disconnected tree in the GNode structure) or another GNode. Multiple GNodes can share the same Parent, which is what gives the tree structure.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: GNode Parent
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: For all GNodes, either Parent(GNode) is null (which means that GNode defines a disconnected tree in the GNode structure) or another GNode. Multiple GNodes can share the same Parent, which is what gives the tree structure.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: A set of specifications that define the structure and content of a message getting sent between GNode Instances
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: MessageProtocol
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: A set of specifications that define the structure and content of a message getting sent between GNode Instances

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: An adjective that applies to phasor and instantaneous current and power measurements associated to TopologyModelNodes and AtomicTNodes. A positive number indicates that current and power are getting consumed (and thus withdrawn) from the grid.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: Withdrawn
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: An adjective that applies to phasor and instantaneous current and power measurements associated to TopologyModelNodes and AtomicTNodes. A positive number indicates that current and power are getting consumed (and thus withdrawn) from the grid.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: An Aggregated TNode that is able to continue to operate when it is disconnected from the bulk power grid.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: IslandableMicrogrid
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: An Aggregated TNode that is able to continue to operate when it is disconnected from the bulk power grid.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: A TNode is short for a Transactive Node. It is a node capable of entering into electric service contracts. It is either an AtomicTNode or an AggregatedTNode. The electric service contracts represent services provided by its AtomicTNodes.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: TNode
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: A TNode is short for a Transactive Node. It is a node capable of entering into electric service contracts. It is either an AtomicTNode or an AggregatedTNode. The electric service contracts represent services provided by its AtomicTNodes.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: This is a core DataObject for Gridworks. It has a human-readable, somewhat memorable name. It is a collection of GNodes and strategies for those GNodes that have been determined to be consistent with each other. More precisely, it is a collection of GRCGNodes (GridRunClass Gnodes) tIt exists as a concept exactly because the agents we design are coupled to each other via the electric grid and their interpretation of the physics of that grid.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: GridRunClass
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: This is a core DataObject for Gridworks. It has a human-readable, somewhat memorable name. It is a collection of GNodes and strategies for those GNodes that have been determined to be consistent with each other. More precisely, it is a collection of GRCGNodes (GridRunClass Gnodes) tIt exists as a concept exactly because the agents we design are coupled to each other via the electric grid and their interpretation of the physics of that grid.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: A rating created by the PV community which we think is always 1000 - refers to the irradiance from the sun used to define Standard Test Conditions (where the RatedPowerInjectedVA is determined)
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: StandardTestCondition_IrradianceWPerM2
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: A rating created by the PV community which we think is always 1000 - refers to the irradiance from the sun used to define Standard Test Conditions (where the RatedPowerInjectedVA is determined)

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: Computed via: RatedAmpacityRMSAmpsFromComponent * BusRatedVoltageVRMS
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: GNode__CableOrWireRatedPowerFlowVA
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: Computed via: RatedAmpacityRMSAmpsFromComponent * BusRatedVoltageVRMS

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: An adjective that applies to phasor and instantaneous current and power measurements associated to TopologyNodes and AtomicTNodes. A positive number indicates that current and power are getting generated (and thus injected) into the grid.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: Injected
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: An adjective that applies to phasor and instantaneous current and power measurements associated to TopologyNodes and AtomicTNodes. A positive number indicates that current and power are getting generated (and thus injected) into the grid.

CoreLexiconTerm.Name: InterconnectionComponent
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn:
An InterconnectionComponent is a component with electrical characteristics that mean it has a non-trivial relationship between voltage and current. In addition, it has a FromNode and ToNode indicating where it connects on each side (and determining the direction of positive current flow).
The TNode and FromNode for an Atomic TerminalAssets, although they can be very complex, are among other things InterconnectionComponents where the ToNode is Ground. This is represented by the GNodeRole TerminalAsset having the attribute IsInterconnectionComponent. The TerminalAsset role takes priority over the InterconnectionComponent role. That is, if a GNode has a role of InterconnectionComponent then it's ToNode cannot be Ground.
As a GNode Role, an InterconnectionComponent must be either a conducting wire (in the air), a cable (in the ground) or a transformer. At present we assume the connection topology is simply between two ConductorTopologyNodes (this may change when we introduce the abstraction of three phases).
Note that every ConductorTopologyNode also represents an InterconnectionComponent - the cable, wire or transformer between it and its parent node (which must also be a ConductorTopologyNode except in the special case of being a GridRoot ... which may or may not have parents).
Combined with the ConductorTopology nodes, the InterconnectionComponent nodes let us complete the conducting graphs. The reference direction is captured by FromNode and ToNode.
CoreLexiconTerm.GNodeRoleDefn:
An InterconnectionComponent is a component with electrical characteristics that mean it has a non-trivial relationship between voltage and current. In addition, it has a FromNode and ToNode indicating where it connects on each side (and determining the direction of positive current flow).
The TNode and FromNode for an Atomic TerminalAssets, although they can be very complex, are among other things InterconnectionComponents where the ToNode is Ground. This is represented by the GNodeRole TerminalAsset having the attribute IsInterconnectionComponent. The TerminalAsset role takes priority over the InterconnectionComponent role. That is, if a GNode has a role of InterconnectionComponent then it's ToNode cannot be Ground.
As a GNode Role, an InterconnectionComponent must be either a conducting wire (in the air), a cable (in the ground) or a transformer. At present we assume the connection topology is simply between two ConductorTopologyNodes (this may change when we introduce the abstraction of three phases).
Note that every ConductorTopologyNode also represents an InterconnectionComponent - the cable, wire or transformer between it and its parent node (which must also be a ConductorTopologyNode except in the special case of being a GridRoot ... which may or may not have parents).
Combined with the ConductorTopology nodes, the InterconnectionComponent nodes let us complete the conducting graphs. The reference direction is captured by FromNode and ToNode.

CoreLexiconTerm.Name: Permanently Deactivated
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: A designation which retires the GNode (i.e. its unique identifer) from having any GNodeEvents at any point in the future.
CoreLexiconTerm.GNodeStatusDefn: A designation which retires the GNode (i.e. its unique identifer) from having any GNodeEvents at any point in the future.

CoreLexiconTerm.Name: Ctn
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn:
A ConductorTopologyNode (Ctn) is a GNode that corresponds to an electrically equivalent copper junction on the electric grid. This means that electrical measurement quantities of current or power withdrawn, voltage, and phase angle are meaningful and well-defined for a ConductTopologyNode.
"Topology Node" is a term used in the Common Information Model that is consistent with the above. This is why we use the word. However we add the "Conductor" for copper to help avoid any confusion with TNodes, where the T standards for Transactive.
All TerminalSSNode children of a ConductorTopologyNode have a special relationship w the CopperToplogy Node: specifically, the assumption is that the TerminalSSNodes are within the 'zone of equivalent phasor/voltage.'
The sum of the power (and current) withdrawn for the TerminalSSNode children of a TopologyNode equals the power (and current) withdrawn for the TopologyNode. This is true for any model of power - DC, phasor, instantaneous. The tree structure on TopologyNodes "follows the copper" - that is, in addition to the above requirement, the parent of a TopologyNode is also a TopologyNode, and electrical power can flow between the two. A TopologyNode therefore also has well defined "flow" electrical measurements associated to it - both current and power - which describe the flow on this edge. The reference direction is taken to be from the parent to the TopologyNode. That is, if there is power flowing from the parent to the TopologyNode it will be a positive measurement.

A ConductorTopologyNode (Ctn) is a GNode that corresponds to an electrically equivalent copper junction on the electric grid. This means that electrical measurement quantities of current or power withdrawn, voltage, and phase angle are meaningful and well-defined for a ConductTopologyNode.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: Example.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: TerminalAssetOperatingMode__Framework
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: Example.

CoreLexiconTerm.Name: AtomicTNode
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn:
An AtomicTNode - short for Atomic Transactive Node - is a TerminalSSNode that has the potential to transact in contracts on behalf of its associated ControllableAsset. At present there is only one Role for this - TerminalAsset. However, transformers for example may also be controllable and could be associated with AtomicTNodes.
Note that "potential" is left as a matter of judgement for the operators of the system. For example, an air compressor with a lot of flexibility in terms of when it operates, but at present no communication capabilities, could have an AtomicTNode associated to it.
The Atomicity of an AtomicTNode means that there are no AtomicTNode children in the GNode tree below AtomicTNodes.
CoreLexiconTerm.GNodeRoleDefn:
An AtomicTNode - short for Atomic Transactive Node - is a TerminalSSNode that has the potential to transact in contracts on behalf of its associated ControllableAsset. At present there is only one Role for this - TerminalAsset. However, transformers for example may also be controllable and could be associated with AtomicTNodes.
Note that "potential" is left as a matter of judgement for the operators of the system. For example, an air compressor with a lot of flexibility in terms of when it operates, but at present no communication capabilities, could have an AtomicTNode associated to it.
The Atomicity of an AtomicTNode means that there are no AtomicTNode children in the GNode tree below AtomicTNodes.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: A core abstraction for any WorldInstance which IsSimulated. TODO: fill in. The TimeStep refers to a specific instance of time within the WorldInstance, specified by the TimeStep.TimeUnixMs. Note that this is in fact derived from the AtomicFrequency of the WorldInstance, and the AtomicIndex of the TimeStep.
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: TimeStep
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: A core abstraction for any WorldInstance which IsSimulated. TODO: fill in. The TimeStep refers to a specific instance of time within the WorldInstance, specified by the TimeStep.TimeUnixMs. Note that this is in fact derived from the AtomicFrequency of the WorldInstance, and the AtomicIndex of the TimeStep.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: This is a term we use to help organize and explain our technology work streams. the LeadingEdge code provides us with a high level of functionality in distributed code as well as a foundation which lets us built resilience when needed. This term is NOT widely used in the software industry. Things you get in this type of code: correct names, no hard coding, the ability to interact with production code via the message protocols. However, there are no unit tests, no error handlers, no restarting, and no back pressure. As the LeadingEdge code builds we will likely start adding end-to-end tests to make sure the functionality is never broken, in order to allow the LeadingEdge code to continue growing. However the high level of investment in terms of coding time to make the system production-ready is not made - the code is intended to test and validate, and to provide a launching pad for effectively, efficiently and incrementally developing production code.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: This is a term we use to help organize and explain our technology work streams. It refers to functional code that illustrates a concept or fleshes out some pseudo-code, but that does not have the ability to interact with LeadEdge or Beta code. Demonstrations in matlab, octave, python or mathematica will fit this category.

CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: This is a term we use to help organize and explain our technology work streams. It refers to functional code that illustrates a concept or fleshes out some pseudo-code, but that does not have the ability to interact with LeadEdge or Beta code. Demonstrations in matlab, octave, python or mathematica will fit this category.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: Node A is a descendant of Node B if and only if B is in the set obtained by closing the set {A} under the Parent operation. In other words, it matches the human language meaning of descendant inherited by the notion of Parent
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: Descendant
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: Node A is a descendant of Node B if and only if B is in the set obtained by closing the set {A} under the Parent operation. In other words, it matches the human language meaning of descendant inherited by the notion of Parent

CoreLexiconTerm.Name: Islanded
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn:
A DieselOperatingMode (in the simpleDC physics paradigm) where the Diesel is responsible for balancing the sum of the ActivePowerW of all the other power sources and sinks in its microgrid. Note that this operating mode implicitly assumes the diesel terminal asset is able to tell what microgrid it belongs to. This is done with the crude mechanism of assigning a network modeler to the diesel generator, and allowing that gnode to tell the diesel to switch into Islanded mode. This assignment mechanism occurs via the associated GridRunClass. When in islanded mode, it sets its ActivePowerW to be the ETQEstimate PowerW sent to it by its network modeler.
This term is often used, somewhat loosely, in Power System Engineering to describe the operating state of a diesel generator which is responsible for balancing a microgrid.
CoreLexiconTerm.DieselOperatingModeSimpleDcDefn:
A DieselOperatingMode (in the simpleDC physics paradigm) where the Diesel is responsible for balancing the sum of the ActivePowerW of all the other power sources and sinks in its microgrid. Note that this operating mode implicitly assumes the diesel terminal asset is able to tell what microgrid it belongs to. This is done with the crude mechanism of assigning a network modeler to the diesel generator, and allowing that gnode to tell the diesel to switch into Islanded mode. This assignment mechanism occurs via the associated GridRunClass. When in islanded mode, it sets its ActivePowerW to be the ETQEstimate PowerW sent to it by its network modeler.
This term is often used, somewhat loosely, in Power System Engineering to describe the operating state of a diesel generator which is responsible for balancing a microgrid.

CoreLexiconTerm.AdHocDefinition: This is derived from the repo and the supervisory gnode. For example, gw-platform-oct2py__sw1.super2. For platform services it is the name of the repo combined with the GNodeRole for that platform service (doesn't need the . For example the WorldInstanceRegistry has the name gw-ps-python__wir - in other words, the gwps prefix of gwps.wir can be dropped since all platform services reside under that world root (the ServiceRoot gwps)
CoreLexiconTerm.Name: SupervisorContainer__SecondDockerNameComponent
CoreLexiconTerm.Defn: This is derived from the repo and the supervisory gnode. For example, gw-platform-oct2py__sw1.super2.
